intro: Catunaregam stipulosa, commonly known as the slender-stipule catunaregam, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
